cv.comment: This is the CadViewer user-preference file. This file is NOT necessary for CadViewer to run properly. However, you should still edit this file with care. Erroneous data may cause CadViewer to not work properly.

machine.comment: Specify the machine that will write files. Without this, when the program runs on a linux cluster, every machine will try to write the same file at te same time.

normalize.comment: Normalizing is necessary when the scene has both lighting and scaling. Without normalizing the colors look either too bright or too dark. By setting this flag to true you tell OpenGL to account for this, which makes the light look correct. However, there can be a significant performance hit. In order to render the scene with good lighting, only the global flag has to be true. If you want to make sure that any exported models also have this flag, then set the models flag to true.

menu.comment: This is the translation and scale of the menu. The results are order-dependent.

status_bar.comment: This is the translation and scale of the status-bar. The results are order-dependent.
Should the status-bar be visible at startup?

speed.comment: The scale-speed is the maximum scale applied per second.
